segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Back up files and directories security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Back up files and directories security policy setting.

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Back up files and directories security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Back up files and directories security policy setting.

segment.source: This user right determines which users can bypass file and directory, registry, and other persistent object permissions for the purposes of backing up the system.
segment.target: This user right determines which users can bypass file and directory, registry, and other persistent object permissions for the purposes of backing up the system.

segment.source: This user right is effective only when an application attempts access through the NTFS backup application programming interface (API) through a backup tool such as NTBACKUP.EXE.
segment.target: This user right is effective only when an application attempts access through the NTFS backup application programming interface (API) through a backup tool such as NTBACKUP.EXE.

segment.source: Otherwise, standard file and directory permissions apply.
segment.target: Otherwise, standard file and directory permissions apply.

segment.source: This user right is similar to granting the following permissions to the user or group you have selected on all files and folders on the system:
segment.target: This user right is similar to granting the following permissions to the user or group you have selected on all files and folders on the system:

segment.source: Restrict the Back up files and directories user right to members of the IT team who must back up organizational data as part of their daily job responsibilities.
segment.target: Restrict the Back up files and directories user right to members of the IT team who must back up organizational data as part of their daily job responsibilities.

segment.source: Because there is no way to be sure that a user is backing up data, stealing data, or copying data to be distributed, only assign this user right to trusted users.
segment.target: Because there is no way to be sure that a user is backing up data, stealing data, or copying data to be distributed, only assign this user right to trusted users.

segment.source: If you are using backup software that runs under specific service accounts, only these accounts (and not the IT staff) should have the Back up files and directories user right.
segment.target: If you are using backup software that runs under specific service accounts, only these accounts (and not the IT staff) should have the Back up files and directories user right.

segment.source: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesUser Rights Assignment
segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesUser Rights Assignment

segment.source: By default, this right is granted to Administrators and Backup Operators on workstations and servers.
segment.target: By default, this right is granted to Administrators and Backup Operators on workstations and servers.

segment.source: On domain controllers, Administrators, Backup Operators, and Server Operators have this right.
segment.target: On domain controllers, Administrators, Backup Operators, and Server Operators have this right.

segment.source: The following table lists the actual and effective default policy values.
segment.target: The following table lists the actual and effective default policy values.

segment.source: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.
segment.target: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.

segment.source: A restart of the device is not required for this policy setting to be effective.
segment.target: A restart of the device is not required for this policy setting to be effective.

segment.source: Any change to the user rights assignment for an account becomes effective the next time the owner of the account logs on.
segment.target: Any change to the user rights assignment for an account becomes effective the next time the owner of the account logs on.

segment.source: Settings are applied in the following order through a Group Policy Object (GPO), which will overwrite settings on the local computer at the next Group Policy update:
segment.target: Settings are applied in the following order through a Group Policy Object (GPO), which will overwrite settings on the local computer at the next Group Policy update:

segment.source: When a local setting is greyed out, it indicates that a GPO currently controls that setting.
segment.target: When a local setting is greyed out, it indicates that a GPO currently controls that setting.

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: Users who can back up data from a device could take the backup media to a non-domain computer on which they have administrative privileges, and then restore the data.
segment.target: Users who can back up data from a device could take the backup media to a non-domain computer on which they have administrative privileges, and then restore the data.

segment.source: They could take ownership of the files and view any unencrypted data that is contained within the backup set.
segment.target: They could take ownership of the files and view any unencrypted data that is contained within the backup set.

segment.source: Restrict the Back up files and directories user right to members of the IT team who must back up organizational data as part of their daily job responsibilities.
segment.target: Restrict the Back up files and directories user right to members of the IT team who must back up organizational data as part of their daily job responsibilities.

segment.source: If you are using backup software that runs under specific service accounts, only these accounts (and not the IT staff) should have the Back up files and directories user right.
segment.target: If you are using backup software that runs under specific service accounts, only these accounts (and not the IT staff) should have the Back up files and directories user right.

segment.source: Changes in the membership of the groups that have the Back up files and directories user right could limit the abilities of users who are assigned to specific administrative roles in your environment.
segment.target: Changes in the membership of the groups that have the Back up files and directories user right could limit the abilities of users who are assigned to specific administrative roles in your environment.

segment.source: You should confirm that authorized backup administrators can still perform backup operations.
segment.target: You should confirm that authorized backup administrators can still perform backup operations.
